And these people who have these large warehouses where they're cooling it with the Arctic cold, somewhere in Scandinavia or in the North Pole even, and they're hooking up their machines correctly so that they don't burn out their cards. You do have less efficiency in the labor of the clearinghouse, but that's a compromise that most of the people who are in Bitcoin are willing to make. And the reason they're willing to make that is because when you concentrate power in a clearinghouse, it's more efficient. But then the clearinghouse has enormous power and they tend to abuse that. First of all, you can't create a transaction which you don't have signing authority over it, whether you control 51% of the network or not, whether you can pull off a 51% attack or not. You still can't control funds that you don't have signing authority or keys for. But you can't spend other people's funds or create transactions that are bogus or signed without having keys and things like that. So there's a big misunderstanding of exactly what you can do.
